reviews.text: This is a difficult review to write as the Julie Jolly was a beautiful hotel but some things just ruined our very short stay here.
reviews.title: Hotel...great. Service...not so great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We treated ourself to a poolside room which was well equipped and absolutely squeaky clean! The pool was great, really clean and the surroundings were nice and peaceful.  The free wifi was a bonus and some of the staff were really friendly.
reviews.title: Good resort for the price

reviews.text: It's about a 10 minute walk to the beach and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great place, super staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What let The Julie Jolly down was the reception staff, they weren't very friendly and didn't seem that enthusiastic about helping you figure out the area. We had to pay one night up front and the next morning the lady from reception was at our door at about 0930 asking if we were staying another night as we'd only paid one night, they then asked for payment again later that day. Every hotel I have ever stayed in takes payment on checkout and so we found this a bit irritating, especially having already paid one night up front and a 1000Rs key deposit.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!

reviews.text: Second annoyance was the carry on with the taxi. We asked the reception to book us a cab to take us onto our next hotel in Anjuna (about 2.5 Km away). When we went to settle our bill they had put 250Rs on the bill to pay for the taxi. We asked them to take this off as we felt it was way above average for the distance so we'd pay the driver directly. Then they said that we had to pay extra for an air conditioned car, again we said we were happy to go without air conditioning for what was likely to be a 10 minute drive.
reviews.title: Staff is terrible!!

reviews.text: Julie Jolly Guest House is a thoroughly avoidable hotel.
reviews.title: Terrible Stay, Terrible Management

reviews.text: We chose this hotel from a bunch of others as it seemed a value for money deal. However, it turned out not to be.
reviews.title: Expensive for what they offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, there was a goof up about the booking itself. The booking clerk was ignorant of the bookings done there and he had to call up his manager to confirm the booking after showing our booking confirmation. Still, they dint have the two 3-bedroom thingy ready so they were kind enough to give us three 2-bedroom, though the rooms were not cleaned (because they had no info about the booking). But they sent people immediately to clean the rooms once we reported. The food options are outright costly (atleast 3-4 times than any average hotel) and the food was not tasty at all. LCD TV is available for name sake. You get no channels properly.
reviews.title: DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their website has an outdated cancellation rules page. You'll get a different rules (with exhorbitant cancellation fees) when you book the rooms. The website cancellation page stated 10% + bank charges if we cancel before 7 days of the accomodation date but when we received the confirmation we had 60% written. We landed paying almost 75% (including bank charges, remember?) when we cancelled the rooms for a day due to our plan change.
reviews.title: quiet and value for money place in north goa

reviews.text: Overall, the atmosphere is good and is about 2 kms to vagator beach. This is a nice place to stay away from the Baga crowd, but this hotel is not worth the money we pay.
reviews.title: Very beautiful and peaceful hotel!

reviews.text: My husband and i came on December 2011, to the pick season in Goa!!
reviews.title: Amazing stay
